OAR.Name: anteriorsegment
OAR.RisqueComplications:
Risk of cataract at 5 years :
5 % : Dmax = 10Gy
18% :Dmax = 14Gy
50%:Dmax = 18Gy
70% :10 Gy in 1 fraction
100%: Dmax = 20-40Gy
OAR.Comment:
The anterior segment of the eyeball consists of the structures ventral from the vitreous humor, including the cornea, iris, ciliary body, and lens.
Henk, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 1993
Parsons, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 1994
Emami, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 1991

OAR.Name: posteriorsegment
OAR.RisqueComplications:
Risk of blindness at 5 years:
5 % : Dmean = 45Gy
50% : Dmean = 65Gy
Risque de rétinopathie à 5ans:
0 % : Dmean < 40-45Gy
Risque de rétinopathie à 5 ans :
0 % : Dmean < 40-45Gy
50% : Dmean = 45-55Gy
83% : Dmean = 55-65Gy
100% : Dmean > 65Gy
OAR.ContraintesPlanification:
Eye-retina :
Dmean inf 45 Gy
Eye (complete) :
V30 Gy < 50% V50 Gy < 30%
OAR.Comment:
The posterior segment of the eyeball is located posteriorly to the lens, and consists of the anterior hyaloid membrane and all of the posterior optical structures including the vitreous humor, retina, and choroid. The optic nerve is excluded.
Emami, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 1991
Danesh, J Clin Neurosci. , 2008

OAR.Name: Brain
OAR.RisqueComplications:
5 % risk of complications at 5 years:
V60 Gy = 33%
OAR.Comment:
The delineation of the brain includes brain vessels, and excludes the brainstem.
Emami, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 1991
Lawrence, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2004

OAR.Name: BrainStem
OAR.Caudal: Tip of the dens of C2
OAR.Comment:
MRI is recommended for delineation of the brainstem.
Debus, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 1997
Nishimura, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2007
Noël, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2001

OAR.Name: Lacrimal gland
OAR.Comment: None

OAR.Name: Chiasm
OAR.Cranial: 1 cm superior to the pituitary gland
OAR.Comment:
MRI is recommended for delineation.
Martel, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 1997
Daly, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2007

OAR.Name: Optic Nerve
OAR.RisqueComplications:
Risk of Blindness at 5 years :
0-5% : Dmax = 50-60Gy 50% : Dmax = 65Gy 5 % Risk of neuropathy at 10 years
if Dmax > 60Gy
Increased risk of optic neuritis at 5 years
3-7%:Dmax = 55-60Gy 7-20%:Dmax > 60Gy
OAR.Comment:
It has to be contoured all the way from the posterior edge of the eyeball, through the bony optic canal to the optic chiasm. MRI is recommended for a better delineation of the optic nerve.
Emami, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 1991
Martel, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 1997
Daly, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2007
Mayo, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2010
Jiang, Radiother Oncol., 2010
Danesh-Meyer, J Clin Neurosci., 2008
Parsons, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 1994

OAR.Name: Pituitary Gland
OAR.Comment:
The inner part of the sella turcica can be used as surrogate anatomical bony
Haberer, Cancer Radiother.., 2010 structure.

OAR.Name: Carotid
OAR.Cranial: Lower part of the optic chiasm.
OAR.Comment: The carotid arteries include the common and internal carotid artery

OAR.Name: Cochlea
OAR.ContraintesPlanification:
Dmean < 40-45 Gy
if preserving hearing is paramount :
Dmean < 35 Gy
OAR.Comment:
The cochlea is embedded in the temporal bone, located lateral to the internal auditory meatus, which can best be recognized in CT bone view settings
Hitchcock, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2009
Bandhare, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2010

OAR.Name: Mandible
OAR.RisqueComplications:
t 5% Risk of radionecrosis at 5 years if :
toothless patients: Dmean > 60 à 65Gy not toothless patients :Dmean > 60Gy
OAR.Comment: The mandible was defined as the entire mandible bone, without teeth.

OAR.Name: Parotid
OAR.Medial: Post. belly digastric m., styloid process, parapharyngeal space
OAR.Anterior: Masseter m., post. border mandibular bone, med. and lat. pterygoid m.
OAR.Posterior: Ant. belly sternocleidomastoid m., lat. side post. belly of the digastric m. (posteriormedial
OAR.Comment:
Include carotid artery, retromandibular vein and extracranial facial nerve
Strigari, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2010
Eisbruch, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 1999
Deasy, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2010

OAR.Name: Extended oral cavity
OAR.Cranial: Hard palate mucosa and mucosal reflections near the maxilla
OAR.Caudal: The base of tongue mucosa and hyoid posteriorly and the mylohyoid m. and ant. belly of the digastric m. anteriorly
OAR.Lateral: Inner surface of the mandible and maxilla
OAR.Anterior: Inner surface of the mandible and maxilla
OAR.Posterior: Post. borders of soft palate, uvula, and more inferiorly the base of tongue
OAR.Comment: None

OAR.Name: Submandibular Gland
OAR.Medial: Lat. surface mylohyoid m.,hyoglossus m., superior and middle pharyngeal constrictor m., anterior belly of the digastric m.
OAR.Lateral: Med. surface med.pterygoid m., med.surface mandibular bone, platysma
OAR.Anterior: Lat. Surface mylohyoid m., hyoglossus m.
OAR.Comment:
Posterior to mandible and maxilla, no inner surface of the lips.
Strigari, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2010

OAR.Name: Pharyngeal Constrictor muscles
OAR.Lateral: Superior: medial pterygoid muscle. Middle: greater horn of hyoid bone. Inferior: superior horn of thyroid cartilage
OAR.Anterior: Superior: hamulus of pterygoid plate; mandibula; base of tongue; pharyngeal lumen. Middle: base of tongue; hyoid. Inferior: soft tissue of supraglottic/glottic larynx
OAR.Comment:
Thickness ~3 mm.
Rancati, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2010
Feng, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2007

OAR.Name: Cricopharyngeal inlet
OAR.Caudal: 1 cm caudal to the lower edge of the cricoid cartilage
OAR.Comment: The crico-pharyngeal inlet represents the transition from the PCM to the cervical esophagus

OAR.Name: Cervical esophagus
OAR.Cranial: 1 cm caudal to the lower edge of the cricoid cartilage
OAR.RisqueComplications: Risque of severe esophagitis if V60 Gy > 30 %
OAR.ContraintesPlanification: Exclusive radiotherapy : Dmax < 69Gy Radiotherapy with concomittant chemotherapy :Dmax < 69Gy
OAR.Comment:
Kim, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2005

Singh, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2003

Wei, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2006
Chapet, Radiother Oncol., 2005

OAR.Name: Lips
OAR.Cranial: Hard palate (lateral), anterior nasal spine (at the midline)
OAR.Caudal: Lower edge teeth sockets, cranial edge mandibular body
OAR.Lateral: Depressor anguli oris m., buccinator m., levator anguli oris m./risorius m. Buccinator
OAR.Comment: None

OAR.Name: Buccal Mucosa
OAR.Medial: Outer surface of the mandible and maxilla, oral cavity/base of tongue/soft pallate
OAR.Comment: Van de Water, Radiother. Oncol., 2009

OAR.Name: Supra Glottic Larynx
OAR.Anterior: Hyoid bone, pre-epiglottic space, thyroid cartilage
OAR.Comment: Christiansen et al. [

OAR.Name: Glotticlarynx
OAR.Caudal: Caudal edge of ant. part of thyroid cartilage
OAR.RisqueComplications:
Risk of voice dysfunction for doses over 60-65Gy
Risk of laryngeal edema for doses over 45Gy
OAR.Comment:
Includes the vocal cords and paraglottic fat.
Dornfeld, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2007
Debelleix, Cancer Radiother., 2010
Sanguinetti, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2007

OAR.Name: Thyroid
OAR.Comment:
The thyroid gland has two connected lobes and is located below the thyroid cartilage. It has considerable contrast compared to its surrounding tissues.
Emami, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 1991

OAR.Name: Arytenoid
OAR.Comment: NA

OAR.Name: Spinal Cord
OAR.Cranial: Tip of the dens of C2
OAR.RisqueComplications:
;Risk of radiation-induced myelitis :
Dmax = 50-50,4Gy with concomittant chemotherapy :
Dmax = 40-45Gy
OAR.ContraintesPlanification:
Dmax < 50 Gy
with concomittant chemotherapy Dmax < 45 Gy
OAR.Comment:
The spinal cord is delineated as the true spinal cord, not the spinal canal. Extend by at least 5 cm caudal to the PTV.
Emami, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 1991
Kong, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2011

OAR.Name: Brachial Plexus
OAR.Cranial: Cranial border of C5, vertebral body
OAR.Caudal: Cranial border of T3, vertebral body
OAR.Medial: Inter vertebral foramen (bony vertebral body), lat. border of 1st rib
OAR.Lateral: Lat. border of: ant. and middle scalene m., pectoralis major, teres major
OAR.Anterior: Post. border of: anterior scalene m.,subclavian artery, axillary vein
OAR.Posterior: Ant. border ofmiddle scalene m., seratus anterior m., subscapularis m.
OAR.Comment:
If the brachial plexus is wrapped around the vascular bundle on the most inferior slices, the vascular structure is included in the contour.
Kong, Int J Radiat Oncol Biol Phys., 2011
